items.name: Clan Dagger
items.text: This broad dagger is carried by dwarves as a weapon, tool, and designation of clan. Losing or having to surrender a clan dagger is considered a mark of embarrassment to most dwarves.

items.name: Club
items.text: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

items.name: Dagger
items.text: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

items.name: Gauntlet
items.text: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

items.name: Katar
items.text: Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

items.name: Light Mace
items.text: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head's metal ridges or spikes.

items.name: Longspear
items.text: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.

items.name: Mace
items.text: With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.

items.name: Morningstar
items.text: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

items.name: Sickle
items.text: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.

items.name: Spear
items.text: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

items.name: Spiked Gauntlet
items.text: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

items.name: Staff
items.text: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

items.name: Bastard Sword
items.text: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

items.name: Battle Axe
items.text: These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

items.name: Bo Staff
items.text: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

items.name: Dogslicer
items.text: This short, curved, and crude makeshift blade often has holes drilled into it to reduce its weight. It's a favored weapon of goblins.

items.name: Elven Curve Blade
items.text: Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.

items.name: Falchion
items.text: This weapon is a heavier, two-handed version of the curved-bladed scimitar. It is weighted toward the blade's end, making it a powerful slashing weapon.

items.name: Fauchard
items.text: A fauchard is similar to a glaive, save that its cutting edge is along the concave side. Fauchards are favored by Crimson Reclaimers for hacking through waves of zombies. The fauchard is a martial melee weapon.

items.name: Filcher's Fork
items.text: This halfling weapon looks like a long, two-pronged fork and is used as both a weapon and a cooking implement.

items.name: Flail
items.text: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather.

items.name: Glaive
items.text: This polearm consists of a long, single-edged blade on the end of a 7-foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

items.name: Gnome Hooked Hammer
items.text: This gnome tool and weapon features a hammer at one end and a curved pick on the other. It's such a strange and awkward weapon that others think the gnomes are slightly erratic for using it.

items.name: Greataxe
items.text: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often “bearded,” having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

items.name: Greatclub
items.text: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

items.name: Greatpick
items.text: This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.

items.name: Greatsword
items.text: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

items.name: Guisarme
items.text: This polearm bears a long, often one-sided, curved blade with a hook protruding from the blunt side of the blade, which can allow its wielder to trip opponents at a distance. Its shaft is usually 8 feet long.

items.name: Halberd
items.text: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.

items.name: Hatchet
items.text: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

items.name: Horsechopper
items.text: Created by goblins to battle horses, this weapon is essentially a long shaft ending in a blade with a large hook.

items.name: Kama
items.text: Similar to a sickle and used in some regions to reap grain, a kama has a short, slightly curved blade and a wooden handle.

items.name: Katana
items.text: A katana is a curved, single-edged sword known for its wickedly sharped blade.

items.name: Kukri
items.text: The blade of this foot-long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.

items.name: Lance
items.text: This spear-like weapon is used by a mounted creature to deal a great deal of damage.

items.name: Light Hammer
items.text: This smaller version of the warhammer has a wooden or metal shaft ending in a metal head. Unlike its heavier cousin, it is light enough to throw.

items.name: Light Pick
items.text: A light pick is a modified mining implement with a wooden shaft ending in a pick head crafted more to pierce armor and flesh than chip rocks.

items.name: Longsword
items.text: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

items.name: Main-gauche
items.text: This parrying dagger features a robust guard to protect the wielder's hand.

items.name: Maul
items.text: Mauls are massive warhammers that must be swung with two hands.

items.name: Nunchaku
items.text: The nunchaku is constructed of two wooden or metal bars connected by a short length of rope or chain.

items.name: Orc Knuckle Dagger
items.text: This stout, metal blade of orc design has a horizontal basket hilt with blades jutting from each end, or sometimes one blade like that of a katar.

items.name: Pick
items.text: A pick designed solely for combat has a sturdy wooden shaft and a heavy, pointed head to deliver devastating blows.

items.name: Ranseur
items.text: This polearm is a long trident with a central prong that's longer than the other two.

items.name: Rapier
items.text: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

items.name: Sai
items.text: This piercing dagger is a metal spike flanked by a pair of prongs that can be used to trap an enemy's weapon.

items.name: Sap
items.text: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

items.name: Scimitar
items.text: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

items.name: Scourge
items.text: A scourge—also known as a cat-o'-nine-tails—is a set of several knotted cords made from cotton or leather and attached to a handle. While most scourges are more suitable for torture than combat, the weapons used by the Order of the Scourge have metal barbs woven in to pierce clothing and armor. The scourge is a martial melee weapon.

items.name: Scythe
items.text: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

items.name: Shield Bash
items.text: A shield bash is not actually a weapon, but a maneuver in which you thrust or swing your shield to hit your foe with an impromptu attack.

items.name: Shield Boss
items.text: Typically a round, convex, or conical piece of thick metal attached to the center of a shield, a shield boss increases the bludgeoning damage of a shield bash.

items.name: Shield Spikes
items.text: These metal spikes are strategically placed on the defensive side of the shield to deal piercing damage with a shield bash.

items.name: Shortsword
items.text: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

items.name: Spiked Chain
items.text: This 4-foot-long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

items.name: Starknife
items.text: From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend like points on a compass rose. When gripping a starknife from the center, the wielder can use it as a melee weapon. It can also be thrown short distances.

items.name: Temple Sword
items.text: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

items.name: Trident
items.text: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

items.name: War Flail
items.text: This large flail has a long shaft connected to a shorter piece of stout wood or metal that's sometimes inlaid with spikes.

items.name: Warhammer
items.text: This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it's always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

items.name: Whip
items.text: This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound.

items.name: Aklys
items.text: The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. Though aklyses aren't available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.

items.name: Aldori Dueling Sword
items.text:
An Aldori dueling sword is a slim, single-bladed dueling sword with a slight curve and
a sharp, reinforced point.

items.name: Dwarven War Axe
items.text: This favored weapon of the dwarves has a large, ornate head mounted on a thick handle. This powerful axe can be wielded with one hand or two.

items.name: Gnome Flickmace
items.text: More a flail than a mace, this weapon has a short handle attached to a length of chain with a ball at the end. The ball is propelled to its reach with the flick of the wrist, the momentum of which brings the ball back to the wielder after the strike.

items.name: Ogre Hook
items.text: Ogres are known for using immense, curved picks called ogre hooks.

items.name: Orc Necksplitter
items.text: This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that's perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.

items.name: Sawtooth Saber
items.text: The signature weapon of the Red Mantis assassins, this curved blade is serrated like a saw, hence the name.
